free: #e In the past, if we Kanakanavu were to build houses, cabins and cultivate fields, our seniors liked to look for the places near a river or stream.
#c 我們Kanakanavu以前若要蓋房子、蓋工寮、或者是開墾田園，我們的老人家喜歡找接近河流或溪流的地方。

free: #e Because when the load of farming work is not heavy, Our Kanakanavu men like to go to rivers or streams to catch fish, shrimps, and crabs.
#c 因為當農事的工作不很多的時候，我們Kanakanavu的男士們就非常喜歡去河流或者是溪谷裡面捕魚、捕蝦、補螃蟹。

free: #e We Kanakanavu have three ways of catching fish and shrimps.
#c 我們kanakanavu捕魚蝦的工具有三種。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e One is angling, which hangs fish up.
#c 第一個方式是垂釣，魚用吊的。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e Another is pusu’uriing.
#c 第二種方式是用火把照明。

free: #e The so-called pusu’uriing is that one brings the stalks of Japanese silvergrass to rivers partucularly after it gets dark in the evening.
#c 所謂用火把照明是利用天暗之後，帶著芒草莖去河裡(溪裡)。
#n pusu’uriing是特別的捕魚方式，用乾的芒草莖點火當照明，魚看到亮光會聚集，趁這個時候將魚捉起。

free: #e And (He) uses his light to beam at the water of rivers.
#c 利用他的亮光來看河流或者溪流的水。

free: #e If there are fish and shrimps, we will takes fish spears and fishing nets to catch fish.
#c 那裏若有魚蝦，我們就拿著魚叉或撈網來補魚。

free: #e But, why on earth do Kanakanavu nowadays no longer pusukiriing?
#c 但是，究竟什麼原因，現在的kanakanavu人不再用火把照明來(捕魚)了?
#n makai這裡為語誤，應為nakai(但是)。
#n kusai，通常表示疑惑的語助詞。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e I don’t know the reason, either.
#c 我也不知道什麼原因。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e In that way...
#c 那樣...

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu

free: #e The other is tumatuuncu.
#c 再來一種方式是毒魚。
#n t<um>a-tuuncu專名，用櫨藤毒魚，打碎櫨藤，取出汁體放入水裡，魚蝦因此而昏厥後可捕捉。

free: #e Before long, fish and shrimps won’t die but will float from the water, becoming dull.
#c 不用多久，魚跟蝦子不會死，但是會浮出水面上，很像呆癡了。

#c 在那個時候，人們就用魚叉或撈網來捕魚。

free: #e but as to t<um>a-tuncu, (it) has to inform everyone to go. It is prohibited that a person goes alone. Other people will get angry.
#c 但是用毒魚的方式來捕魚的話，必須通告所有的人來參與，不可以只有一個人去，其他人會生氣的。
#n 傳統上，要t<um>a-tuncu的話，需要通知管理河流的氏族。

free: #e Well, in the past, all poeple t<um>a-tuncu together maybe once or twice a year.
#c 嗯，以前或許一年一次或者兩次大家一起前往去毒魚。

free: #e What I like to join most is fishing.
#c 我最喜歡參加的是釣魚。

free: #e If there is a senior says “Pani, we will go fishing tomorrow,” ah, I will be very happy at that time and keep waiting, thinking why we still don’t get up because I’ve wanted to go.
#n tuu是布農族語，發語詞。
#c 如果有長輩說，Pani我們明天要釣魚，啊，我就在那裏非常開心，一直等待著怎麼還沒起床，因為想要去了。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e But if we want to fish, we need to prepare a fishing pole and hook.
#c 但是如果要釣魚，我們要準備吊桿、魚鉤。

free: #e Kanavuravu is a kind of sinocalamus latiflorus. In fact, the one who goes fishing will use kapani.
#c 以前Kanakanavu的釣竿是使用細的桂竹，要生鮮的，我們尋找比較直的竹子，拿了之後還要稍微用火烤。
#n Kanavuravu是麻竹，事實上要釣魚的話會用kapani(桂竹)。

free: #e The temperature should be a little higher. After it gets heated, one needs to straighten the bamboo. Such a fishing pole is good.
#c 要熱一點，熱了以後，要把它變直。像那樣的釣竿才是好的。
#n ta’iing為口誤，應為ti’iing
#n 應為pa-su-’inac-ʉn 使變直。
#n 應為pia=capa，此為口誤。

free: #e We still need to prepare...what’s that...yup, the hook.
#c 我們還要準備，那是什麼啊，對啦，魚鉤。
#n 有些族人會把iisua說成iihua。

free: #e There are fishing poles and hooks. We have to get up early.
#c 有了釣竿、魚鉤，我們要很早起床。
#n cepa、capa都是語誤，應為pee-capa
#n cʉmcʉm指天未亮的時候，就已經進行行動

free: #e (We) need to pass through the muddy area because there are earthworms.
#c 要經過泥濘的地方，因為那裏有蚯蚓。

free: #e (We) need to catch ten to twelve earthworms and bring them to the river.
#c 要抓十到二十條的蚯蚓，帶到河裡。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e After arriving in the river, we take that earthworm and put it on the hook and toss (the hook) toward the water.
#c 到了河裡之後，就拿那個蚯蚓放在魚鉤上，拋向水裡。
#n 應為masikusa

free: #e it is said that bigger fish often stay...well...in rapid currents.
#c 我聽以前的老人家說比較大的魚經常待在...那個...比較湍急的水。
#n ma-marang可指稱老人家、長者、父母親，這裡老人家

free: #e I sometimes fish in more rapid water. But I’m afraid that the hook gets stuck among the stones and cannot be pulled back. I will be bothered there.
#c 我也嘗試在湍急的河流釣魚，但是又擔心魚鉤鉤住石頭而拉不回來，我就會在那邊很困擾。
#n tarʉ’-ʉn應該為tavarʉ’-ʉn，此為語誤。

free: #e So, I like to fish in deep water more.
#c 所以，我比較喜歡在深潭，待在那裡釣魚。

free: #e but the fish in deep water there truely are relatively not big.
#c 但是在深潭那裏的魚的確比較不大。

free: #e In the past, when we went fishing with our seniors and the fish can fill half of the creel, the seniors would say "Pani, go take the dry wood and go there to make a fire."
#c 以前我們若跟著老一輩的人一起釣魚，當我們釣的魚已經到魚簍的一半的時候，通常我們的老人家就會呼喊著說：「Pani，你去拿乾材或者竹子到河流的邊邊上生火。」

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu

meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e I said to them "It isn’t noon, why do we need to make a fire?"
#c 我跟他們說還沒到中午，為什麼要起火。
#n matavʉcʉke taniarʉ中午
#n 本來是matuapulu升火

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e The old people replied, "Don’t you see it? The creel is so full that our fish are going to drop out. Some of the fish need to be roasted so that they won’t rot."
#c 老人家回答:「你沒看到嗎?我們的魚要滿出魚簍了，一部分要烤起來，才不會腐爛。」
#n cʉ’ʉroon 看(使役)
#n cucumeen在此發音人解釋為一部分的魚

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

gloss: 知道.主焦=狀態改變=1SG.主格
free: #e “Ah, I get it.”
#c 啊！我知道了。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

gloss: 在.主焦=狀態改變=1PL.主格.排除

free: #e We little kids then made a fire over there.
#c 我們小朋友們就在河邊上升火。

free: #e The old people gave us the fish.
#c 老人家就給我們魚。

free: #e The bigger fish, we take out their bowels, wash a little, and roast on the burning charcoal.
#c 比較大的魚，我們取出牠的腸子，把腸子稍微洗一洗，拿到火炭上跟魚一起烤。
#n cumapa和c<um>acapa都是烤的意思

meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #n iak驚嘆詞，表示很滿足。
#n iak驚嘆詞，表示很滿足。

free: #e Ah, the bowels, shrimps, and fish tasted so awesome at that time.
#c 啊!那當下腸子、蝦子、魚真是好吃啊!
#n kʉne-en本來是noo kʉnʉn簡化

free: #e Such like that, for us Kanakanavu, it is a pleasing event to talk about fishing. (We) are willing to join in (this activity).
#c 我們kanakanavu提到像這些釣魚這件事是一件令人很愉悅的事情，都很樂於一同參加。

free: #e When winter comes, if there is good moss in water, we will still pick the moss out with wood sticks.
#c 當冬天的時候，如果水中有好的川苔，我們就會使用樹枝把川苔捲起來。

free: #e We cook soup. When the water is boiling, we put the moss in.
#c 我們煮湯，當水沸騰了以後，我們就放入川苔。

free: #e If there are shrimps─small ones should be better, crabs, and small fish, (we) put (all) into that pot of soup.
#c 如果有蝦子，最好是小的，還有螃蟹、小的魚，放進那鍋湯裡面。

free: #e “Ah,” I heard the old people say like this in the past, “Ah, among all the kinds of soup, this (soup) is the best.”
#c 「啊!」以前我聽到老人家說出這樣的話:「啊!所有的湯裡面，這個湯是最好的。」

free: #e Ah, We think that we Kanakanavu’s way of living in the past is reminiscent whenever I recall.
#c 啊!想起來我們Kanakanavu以往的生活方式真的令我很快樂。
#n 使用重疊詞表示延續、加強

free: #e So, such like the places we live in, we have to keep them well so as to let our offspring have good places to grow up.
#c 所以，像這些我們所住的地方，我們要把它弄得好好的，使我們的後代將來也有美好的地方可以生活成長。

free: #e Ah, this is what I want to say. That’s it.
#n matirupangʉ結束、完成
#c 啊！我要說的就是這樣，僅此。
